title: Rafael van der Vaart has told Tottenham to sign Ajax star Hakim Ziyech
text:
Former Tottenham icon Rafael van der Vaart has told Daniel Levy to replace Christian Eriksen with Ajax ace Hakim Ziyech.

Eriksen is in the final year of his contract at Spurs and looks set for the exit, with the Denmark international showing no interest in opening extension talks.

That leaves a sizeable hole in Mauricio Pochettino's squad to be filled next season, and Van der Vaart has reavealed he has already advised the club's chairman on the perfect replacement.

Rafael Van der Vaart has told Tottenham chairman Daniel Levy to target Ajax's Hakim Ziyech

'I hope Ziyech goes to Tottenham and I think it will be. I talked to Levy and said: "Sign Ziyech after this season", ' he told Studio Voetbal, as per AS.com.

'I am convinced that it would cause a sensation in London.'

Ziyech, who was part of the Ajax squad that took Europe by storm last season when they reached the semi-finals of the Champions League, has started strongly once more for the Dutch outfit.

The 26-year-old Morocco international has 15 goal involvements in 18 appearances so far this season, socring six times and setting up a further nine.
description: Eriksen is in the final year of his contract at Spurs and looks set for the exit, with the Denmark international showing no interest in opening extension talks. Hakim Ziyech could slot right in.
